title: 10: Hygiene in the shed? Let the cows tell you! Scoring system

tasks.task: Scoring cow hygiene in a dairy shed.
subtasks: Observe and inspect cows' flank, tail area.
Evaluate dirtiness in lower hind legs.
Assign score (0, 1, or 2) based on dirt accumulation.
Interpret scoring results to identify hygiene issues.
Differentiate cleaning problems (passageways, drainage) from lying area issues.
Consider udder and hind leg dirtiness in problem diagnosis.
Analyze widespread dirtiness for overcrowding or manure removal concerns.
Explain how bacteria enter the teat end via the teat canal.
Describe the battle between bacteria and cow's immune system in mastitis.

tasks.task: MAINTASK: Scoring cow hygiene in a dairy shed.
subtasks: Observe and inspect cows' flank (including the tail) for dirtiness.
Evaluate the dirtiness level in the lower hind legs of cows.
Assess the udder's cleanliness and assign a score based on the level of dirtiness.
Interpret the hygiene scores (0, 1, or 2) to determine shed hygiene issues.
Identify specific hygiene problems in cleaning passageways, drainage, lying areas, or overcrowding based on the dirtiest part of the cow.
Explain how bacteria invade the teat end via the teat canal.
Describe the immune response to mastitis infection in dairy cows.
